data.title: Wilhelm wien
data.meta_description: Wilhelm wien - Download as a PDF or view online for free
data.text:
2.  Wien’s father's name is Carl Wien.  Wien was born on January 13, 1864. He is from Fischhausen, in East Prussia  He is a German Physicist and is white.  Wien became famous for Blackbody radiation.  Got married in 1898 to Luise Mehler of Aix-la-Chapelle and later had four children.  He became a professor in Munich and remained there the rest of his life.  He died in Munich on August 30, 1928.

3.  In 1882, Wien went to the University of Gottingen to study mathematics and natural sciences and later that year went to the University of Berlin.  Before he finished his studies, Wien’s father got ill and he had to leave school to help his father out.  Wien was able to study one semester with Helmholtz.  He was a member of the Academies of Sciences of Berlin, Gottingen, Vienna, Christiania and Washington, and the Physical Society of Frankfurt-on-Main.

4.  1887 – Experimented on the permeability of metals, light, and heat rays.  1893 - He announced the law of displacement, stating that the wavelength changes with the temperature  1894 - Published a paper on temperature and the entropy of radiation.  1900 - Published his Lehrbuch der Hydrodynamik (Textbook of hydrodynamics)
